content:
• Friday, July 20, 2012
  • TRQ

    Ivanhoe Mines (IVN -5.5%) fell to $8.40 after completing a previously-announced $1.8B rights...

    Ivanhoe Mines (IVN -5.5%) fell to $8.40 after completing a previously-announced $1.8B rights offering aimed at financing its Oyu Tolgoi copper/gold project. Ivanhoe issued 260M shares in the offering, which translates into a price of $6.92. As expected, 51% owner Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO) bought as many shares as it was legally allowed to. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • CY

    Cypress Semiconductor (CY -6.7%) tumbled to fresh 52-week lows as the Street digested the...

    Cypress Semiconductor (CY -6.7%) tumbled to fresh 52-week lows as the Street digested the chipmaker's Q2 revenue miss and (especially) soft Q3 guidance. Rival Atmel (ATML -5.2%) also fell. UBS is worried Cypress' touchscreen controller business, which many once had high hopes for, now resembles some of its other chip businesses, such as USB controllers and capacitive sensors. Those businesses typically carry low margins, and are highly competitive.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • FWRD

    Forward Air (FWRD +7.2%) is up today after beating Q2 estimates late yesterday. Net profit...

    Forward Air (FWRD +7.2%) is up today after beating Q2 estimates late yesterday. Net profit jumped 18% Y/Y as the truckload carrier and contractor for the air cargo industry reported strong revenue growth from its airport-to-airport services.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • GORO

    Shares of Gold Resource (NYSEMKT:GORO) get hammered today, -26.7% after the company reported...

    Shares of Gold Resource (NYSEMKT:GORO) get hammered today, -26.7% after the company reported disappointing preliminary production results for Q2 2012 late yesterday. Production was lower than expected, and as a result, the company lowered its targeted annual production range by 15% to 100,000 to 120,000 ounces.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM | 4 Comments
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -6.5%) is sliding on heavy volume. Reuters reports the SEC's Texas office...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -6.5%) is sliding on heavy volume. Reuters reports the SEC's Texas office has been demanding documents from Chesapeake as part of the agency's probe into the company's deals with CEO Aubrey McClendon. Meanwhile, Baker Hughes (BHI +9.4% - previous) reports the rig count for U.S. natural gas wells has fallen to 518 thanks to weak prices. That figure is down 45% from October's high, and represents a 13-year low.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 10 Comments
  • MGLN

    Consolidation in the health care sector continues to be the story today, as Magellan Health...

    Consolidation in the health care sector continues to be the story today, as Magellan Health (NASDAQ:MGLN) gains another 3.6% - on the back of yesterday's +8% pop - after saying it's been working with Credit Suisse for months exploring strategic alternatives, including a potential sale. Speculation is that the sale process is now at an advanced stage.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • EBAY

    An upgrade to Overweight from JPMogran is helping eBay (EBAY +2.7%) rally on a down day, and add...

    An upgrade to Overweight from JPMogran is helping eBay (EBAY +2.7%) rally on a down day, and add to yesterday's big post-earnings gains. Though eBay is up 45% YTD, JPMorgan sees additional gains thanks to growing retail partnerships for all 3 of the company's main businesses - Marketplaces, PayPal, and GSI Commerce -  and its strong mobile footprint. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • CMG

    Add one more sell side name to the list of firms giving harsh treatment to Chipotle's (CMG -22%)...

    Add one more sell side name to the list of firms giving harsh treatment to Chipotle's (CMG -22%) poor Q2 results. UBS now says it expects margins to be pressured as same store sales growth continues to slow, and food prices re-accelerate. It slashes its price target on the shares by 20% to $355 from $443, but maintains its Neutral rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 5 Comments
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK +13.2%) continues surging after offering better-than-feared Q3 guidance to go with...

    SanDisk (SNDK +13.2%) continues surging after offering better-than-feared Q3 guidance to go with its Q2 report. Though SanDisk still expects to see a double-digit Y/Y revenue drop, growing flash memory usage in the smartphone, tablet, and solid-state drive markets is keeping a worst-case scenario from unfolding. RBC thinks earnings call comments about "custom embedded solutions" suggests orders from Apple, which has been relying on rivals. MU +1.5%. OCZ +2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • CSOD

    Cloud software vendors Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD +5.1%) and Constant Contact (CTCT +2.9%) trade...

    Cloud software vendors Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD +5.1%) and Constant Contact (CTCT +2.9%) trade higher after Credit Suisse initiates with Outperform ratings, as part of a broader coverage launch for the software sector. Also started at Outperform, but moving lower with the market: KNXA, CNQR, ULTI, RP, MKTG, JIVE.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • ONXX

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) resumes trading, +9.6% to $75.

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) resumes trading, +9.6% to $75.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD -11.9%) crashes to levels last seen in '09 after the Q3 guidance accompanying its Q2...

    AMD (AMD -11.9%) crashes to levels last seen in '09 after the Q3 guidance accompanying its Q2 report stokes the fears of weak PC demand and share losses that arose following the chipmaker's July 9 warning. Wedbush is downgrading shares to Neutral, arguing AMD is suffering from notebook CPU share losses, weak desktop channel demand, an inventory build-up, and slow uptake for Bulldozer server CPUs, which compete with Intel's Romley. INTC -1.8%. NVDA -3%. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 9 Comments
  • BHGE

    Baker Hughes (BHI +9.7%) shares surge near the top of the S&P 500 after the oilfield service...

    Baker Hughes (BHI +9.7%) shares surge near the top of the S&P 500 after the oilfield service firm posted higher-than-expected profits as revenue piled up outside North America. BHI stuck with its forecast for 8% growth in the international rig count this year (excluding Iraq) and expects five more deepwater rigs in the Gulf of Mexico to join the 24 already there later this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • SAN

    It's a "risk off" day for European financials (EUFN -3.4%), after Spain's expected bank bailout...

    It's a "risk off" day for European financials (EUFN -3.4%), after Spain's expected bank bailout approval is accompanied by a weak GDP forecast. Unsurprisingly, Spanish banks are the biggest losers: SAN -7.7%. BBVA -8.4%. U.S. banks are only doing better by comparison (XLF -1.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 8 Comments
  • MNTA

    Momenta Pharmaceutical (MNTA -5.7%) takes a hit after UBS downgraded the shares to Neutral...

    Momenta Pharmaceutical (MNTA -5.7%) takes a hit after UBS downgraded the shares to Neutral earlier this morning, citing limited near-term catalysts and cash burn following the recent negative court ruling in the Copaxone case. The firm retains its price target of $15.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL -9%) falls hard after Piper reiterates an Underweight and lowers its PT...

    Universal Display (PANL -9%) falls hard after Piper reiterates an Underweight and lowers its PT to $28. The firm expects total materials sales to fall this year and next, as customers begin using PANL's products more efficiently, and (unlike others) doesn't expect new deals with major display manufacturers anytime soon. Piper's comments are overshadowing a deal with Plextronics to develop new OLED manufacturing systems. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • LGND

    Ligand (LGND +1.5%) continues to move up following the FDA's approval of Onyx's (NASDAQ:ONXX)...

    Ligand (LGND +1.5%) continues to move up following the FDA's approval of Onyx's (NASDAQ:ONXX) Kyprolis. The drug is to be used for the treatment of relapsed and refractory multiple myelomas, and was developed using LGND's Capitsol formulation system.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • MS

    Morgan Stanley (MS -2.2%) is in advanced talks with Qatar's sovereign wealth fund about an...

    Morgan Stanley (MS -2.2%) is in advanced talks with Qatar's sovereign wealth fund about an investment in the bank's commodities unit and a deal could be imminent, CNBC reports. Such a stake could give the fund a toehold in the global business of trading paper and physical stocks of commodities such as crude oil, natural gas and metals, while providing an influx of capital for MS.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • GOOG

    Unlike Microsoft, Google (GOOG +3.1%) is holding onto its post-earnings gains. The Street is...

    Unlike Microsoft, Google (GOOG +3.1%) is holding onto its post-earnings gains. The Street is taking heart in strong Y/Y paid click growth and a halt to recent ad price declines. However, some are still worried ad prices remain well below year-ago levels, and wish Google provided details about Motorola's full-quarter performance. Deutsche sees rising mobile ad prices and higher shopping-related mobile search activity giving Google a 2H lift. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • ONXX

    More on Onyx (NASDAQ:ONXX): Adam Feurstein at TheStreet.com is speculating that Kyprolis, the...

    More on Onyx (NASDAQ:ONXX): Adam Feurstein at TheStreet.com is speculating that Kyprolis, the company's multiple myeloma drug, has been approved. The FDA's Oncologic Drugs Advisory Committee is reviewing the drug at its meeting today. Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND +0.8%) is spiking higher on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • ONXX

    Trading in Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) has been halted with news pending. The stock is...

    Trading in Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) has been halted with news pending. The stock is currently +5.2%, having last traded at $71.95.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • KYAK

    Kayak's (NASDAQ:KYAK) IPO is nearly as strong as Palo Alto Networks'. Shares opened at $30.24...

    Kayak's (NASDAQ:KYAK) IPO is nearly as strong as Palo Alto Networks'. Shares opened at $30.24 and are currently moving at $33.34, up 28.2% from a $26 offering price. That's good for a market cap of $1.29B. A small 3.5M-share float is likely helping the travel search engine's cause. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • TEF

    Telefonica (TEF -8.6%), Telecom Italia (TI -5.9%), and France Telecom (FTE -4%) slump following...

    Telefonica (TEF -8.6%), Telecom Italia (TI -5.9%), and France Telecom (FTE -4%) slump following Vodafone's (VOD -2.3%) disappointing FQ1 report. The carrier reported Y/Y revenue declines of 7.7% and 10%, respectively, for its Italian and Spanish ops. A downbeat Spanish GDP forecast and a general selloff in Euro stocks probably aren't helping either.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 3 Comments
  • TWX

    The shooting deaths of 12 movie-goers in Aurora, Colo., at a showing of The Dark Knight Rises...

    The shooting deaths of 12 movie-goers in Aurora, Colo., at a showing of The Dark Knight Rises could dampen box office enthusiasm for the new Batman movie. Time Warner (TWX +0.2%) cancels this weekend's Paris premiere; NYC police is providing extra security at theaters. Shares of Cinemark (CNK -3%), owner of the theater where the shooting took place, and Imax (IMAX -1.7%) are down.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 3 Comments
  • RMBS

    Rambus (RMBS -15.1%) dives following its Q2 miss. During its earnings call, the memory...

    Rambus (RMBS -15.1%) dives following its Q2 miss. During its earnings call, the memory technology firm noted licensing income fell 12% Q/Q thanks to lower royalty payments from Nvidia, and lower variable fees from Samsung and bankrupt Elpida. Rambus also guided for Q3 revenue of $54M-$60M, below a consensus of $62M, and said it's uncertain about future Elpida payments, as the DRAM maker is absorbed by long-time Rambus nemesis Micron.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • SLB

    Schlumberger (SLB +1.7%) isn't seeing signs of a slowdown in international activity, despite...

    Schlumberger (SLB +1.7%) isn't seeing signs of a slowdown in international activity, despite increasing concerns over a shaky global economy, CEO Paal Kibsgaard says following its solid Q2 results. "Absent a future setback to the world economy, we're expecting 10% international growth" in operations this year, he said during a conference call.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • SOMX

    Somaxon Pharmaceuticals (SOMX -19%) gets smacked after saying its selling approximately 9.4M...

    Somaxon Pharmaceuticals (SOMX -19%) gets smacked after saying its selling approximately 9.4M shares of its common stock and warrants in a registered direct offering to purchase up to approximately 4.7M shares of its common stock to institutional investors at $0.32 per share and per warrant. Aggregate proceeds from the transaction will total approximately $3.0M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW) delivers a strong IPO. Shares opened at $55.20 and are currently...

    Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW) delivers a strong IPO. Shares opened at $55.20 and are currently trading at $56.78, up 35% from an offering price of $42. That gives the high-flying security hardware startup a valuation of $3.8B, and serves as further proof the market for enterprise tech IPOs remains hot. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • AONEQ

    Volatile A123 Systems (AONE +17.2%) rebounds all the way to $0.82 after reaching a deal with...

    Volatile A123 Systems (AONE +17.2%) rebounds all the way to $0.82 after reaching a deal with China's Ray Power Systems to supply a 2MW grid energy storage system. Though 2MW may not sound like much, Ray Power proclaims the deal will "validate the technical capabilities" of grid storage, and A123 is hopeful it will open up new opportunities in China. Selling energy tech in the country has its risks, as American Superconductor and Maxwell can vouch. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 5 Comments
  • CMG

    In addition to Whole Foods, many fast-food, restaurant, and coffee chains are falling due to...

    In addition to Whole Foods, many fast-food, restaurant, and coffee chains are falling due to Chipotle's (CMG -22.4%) revenue miss and soft guidance, with upscale names particularly in the crosshairs. PNRA -4.5%. SBUX -3.2%. BWLD -5.5%. BJRI -4.9%. DNKN -3.5%. YUM -2.8%. TXRH -3.3%. Chipotle has been seen as best-of-breed in the fast-food space (and valued accordingly): it's little surprise a top-line miss and comments about slowing traffic growth are raising alarm bells.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 11 Comments
  • CPHD

    Cepheid (CPHD -22%) shares plunge after Q2 earnings fell 38%, hurt by higher costs that masked...

    Cepheid (CPHD -22%) shares plunge after Q2 earnings fell 38%, hurt by higher costs that masked strong revenue growth, and the company lowered full-year earnings targets. But Baird believes the weakness could be a buying opportunity, citing CPHD's test menu expansion, highly differentiated positioning and strong base growth; the firm rates shares at Outperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • NOK

    A day after bouncing on a mixed Q2 report, Nokia (NOK -6.5%) is slumping towards pre-earnings...

    A day after bouncing on a mixed Q2 report, Nokia (NOK -6.5%) is slumping towards pre-earnings levels. Fitch is downgrading Nokia's credit rating yet again (previous), and many analysts are cutting their PTs. "Nokia's story remains theoretical pending consumer adoption of [Windows Phone 8]," Barclays asserts. Yesterday, the WSJ took a look at the poor judgment and slow-footed culture that helped cost Nokia its smartphone lead, in spite of huge R&D investments. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 25 Comments
  • CMG

    Sell-side firms are harsh on Chipotle (CMG -21%) after the big post-earnings drop on growth...

    Sell-side firms are harsh on Chipotle (CMG -21%) after the big post-earnings drop on growth concerns and rising food costs. Thus far, CMG has been removed from the Conviction Buy list at Goldman, and downgraded at Janney and Deutsche Bank. Whole Foods (WFM -5.6%) opens sharply lower following the negative sentiment.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 8 Comments
  • EDU

    New Oriental Education (NYSE:EDU) +10.9% premarket after announcing it is forming an independent...

    New Oriental Education (NYSE:EDU) +10.9% premarket after announcing it is forming an independent special committee to review allegations raised in the report issued this week by Muddy Waters.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • WDC

    Premarket gainers: SNDK +12%. PSTI +9%. BHI +9%. SXC +8%. Losers: CMG -19%. CPHD -15%. SAN -6%....

    Premarket gainers: SNDK +12%. PSTI +9%. BHI +9%. SXC +8%.
    Losers: CMG -19%. CPHD -15%. SAN -6%. TEF -6%. NOK -6%. VHC -5%. PNRA -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 2 Comments
  • SPLK

    Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK) -2.3% after pricing its previously-announced, 11.7M-share, secondary...

    Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK) -2.3% after pricing its previously-announced, 11.7M-share, secondary offering at $28.25. Shares closed yesterday at $29.19. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • ONXX

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) +3.8% premarket as shares are upgraded to Outperform with a...

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) +3.8% premarket as shares are upgraded to Outperform with a price target of $82 (from $65) at Leerink Swann. The firm says the failure of Bristol-Myers' (BMY -0.4%) brivanib to meet its primary survival objective is a "significant positive" for the long-term outlook for ONXX's Nexavar liver cancer treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • MS

    CLSA's Mike Mayo upgrades Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS) by two notches to Outperform from Underpeform...

    CLSA's Mike Mayo upgrades Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS) by two notches to Outperform from Underpeform with a price target of $16 (from $15), following Q2 earnings which fell short of Street estimates and sparked a 5% drop in the stock. Nevertheless, MS -1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • XRX

    Xerox's (NYSE:XRX) revised guidance and unimpressive earnings report put downward pressure on...

    Xerox's (NYSE:XRX) revised guidance and unimpressive earnings report put downward pressure on the stock; currently -5.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM
  • CMG

    Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) crumbles premarket after a weak earnings report yesterday that reflected a...

    Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) crumbles premarket after a weak earnings report yesterday that reflected a slowdown in customer traffic growth. CFO Jack Hartung also warned extreme weather may boost food costs this year and next. Shares -16.8%. (conference call transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:47 AM | 8 Comments
  • ALV

    Autoliv (NYSE:ALV): Q2 EPS of $1.33 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $2.09B (+1.4% Y/Y) misses by...

    Autoliv (NYSE:ALV): Q2 EPS of $1.33 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $2.09B (+1.4% Y/Y) misses by $20M. Shares -2.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:24 AM
  • VOD

    Vodafone (NASDAQ:VOD): FQ1 service revenue +0.6% vs. consensus of +0.8%. Total sales -7.7% to...

    Vodafone (NASDAQ:VOD): FQ1 service revenue +0.6% vs. consensus of +0.8%. Total sales -7.7% to £10.77B vs. £10.91B consensus. From the conference call: "[I]t’s difficult to be hugely optimistic about the near term changes in things... Our sense is we should prepare the business for a few more quarters that are going to be reasonably tough." Shares -2.9% in London. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 AM | 1 Comment
